summary: Email chain between a contractor and a US Attorney's Office (SDNY) employee regarding the transfer and copying of data from a hard drive for the case US v. Epstein. The contractor confirms receipt, copying, and shipment of the drive, and provides a spreadsheet detailing data sets, noting which were duplicates or supplemental.

persons.name: Contractor
persons.role: Data handling contractor for US Attorney's Office
persons.context: The individual who received, copied, and shipped back a hard drive containing case data, and provided a detailed spreadsheet analysis of the data contents.

events.title: Hard drive data copied and shipped for US v. Epstein
events.description: A contractor confirms copying data from a hard drive related to US v. Epstein and shipping it to a vendor. A spreadsheet detailing the data contents, including duplicate and supplemental data sets, is provided.

keyFacts: A hard drive containing data for the case US v. Epstein was sent to a contractor for copying and analysis in July 2020.
The contractor provided a spreadsheet listing specific data set identifiers (e.g., NYCO24328, NYCO24363) and noted which were duplicates from a prior shipment and which were supplemental.
The data handling and chain of custody for digital evidence in the Epstein case was being managed by the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY).
